marketNews.title: Car Sales Slowdown Begins
marketNews.content:
Wholesale car sales in Indonesia in May 2024 were recorded at 71,263 units, up +46.5% month‑on‑month but down -13.3% year‑on‑year. Cumulatively over the first five months of 2024, wholesale car sales reached only 334,897 units (‑21% YoY), fulfilling just 30.4% of the 2024 target set by Gaikindo at the 1.1 million‑unit level.

In May 2024, Astra International (ASII) recorded wholesale car sales of 40,876 units, up +54.1% MoM but down -12.5% YoY. This result brings ASII's sales for the first five months of 2024 to 187,446 units, down -19.1% YoY. The smaller decline in ASII's sales compared with competitors on an annual basis – both in May 2024 and over the first five months – increased ASII's market share relative to last year. Brand‑wise, Daihatsu supported ASII's sales with a far more moderate decline than Toyota + Lexus.

Meanwhile, sales from ASII's competitors fell deeper, with total non‑ASII brand sales in May 2024 reaching 30,387 units (+37.5% MoM, -14.4% YoY). Cumulatively, total non‑ASII brand sales for the first five months of 2024 amounted to 147,451 units, down -23.3% YoY. Wuling gained market share during the first five months, while Honda and Hyundai experienced declines throughout the year.

After the release of the May 2024 wholesale car sales data, Gaikindo kept its sales target at the 1.1 million‑unit level.

Key Takeaway

Although wholesale car sales appear difficult to meet Gaikindo's target, we assess that signs of improvement are emerging. This is reflected in the slowdown of the sales decline, from around -20% YoY in previous months to about -10% YoY in May 2024.

Therefore, monthly wholesale car sales should be monitored by investors. Given ASII's valuation is already low (1‑Year Forward P/E 6x, P/BV 0.85x), a continued recovery signal in car sales could be responded to positively by market participants.

marketNews.title: INCO Absents Dividend, Announces Rights Issue Price
marketNews.content:
President Joko Widodo said that the rupiah exchange rate in the range of 16,200‑16,300 per US dollar remains in a good position, and noted that all countries experience pressure on their currencies against the US dollar. This comment contrasts with Economy Minister Airlangga Hartarto, who in April 2024 asked state‑owned enterprises to postpone large US‑dollar purchases in order to reduce depreciation pressure on the rupiah. Since the start of the year, the rupiah has depreciated -5.5% year‑to‑date to a level of 16,295 per US dollar as of Tuesday (11/6).

National Food Agency head Arief Prasetyo Adi forecasts that rice prices will rise in the next 2‑3 months due to a decline in national rice production in the second half of 2024. He also mentioned that rice prices could surge beyond the highest retail price (HET) set on 5 June 2024. Based on the BPS sample‑area framework, rice production from January to July 2024 has a deficit of up to 2.6 million tons.

OJK Executive Inarno Djajadi said there are 141 pipeline IPO offerings with an indicative total value of 56.92 trillion rupiah as of Monday (10/6). Among these, 81 issuers are queued for IPOs with a combined indicative value of 11.85 trillion rupiah.

Inarno also explained that the Special Monitoring Board policy with a full call auction (FCA) mechanism applied on the IDX is a best practice for trading penny stocks, following the New York Stock Exchange and studied since 2019. With the FCA mechanism, stocks that were stuck at a price of 50 rupiah per share can become liquidly traded with a more reasonable price formation.

OJK recorded that total household debt through online lending reached 62.74 trillion rupiah in April 2024, up +24.16% year‑on‑year. OJK PVML Executive Agusman said the aggregate non‑performing credit risk (TWP 90) as of April 2024 remained at 2.79%, down from March 2024's 2.94%.

The Ministry of State‑Owned Enterprises officially appointed former Finance Minister and National Campaign Team (TKN) member Fuad Bawazier as President Commissioner of MIND ID. In addition, the ministry appointed Grace Natalie as Commissioner of MIND ID.

tickerNews.title: INCO Declines Dividend and Announces Rights Issue Price
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Vale Indonesia (INCO) decided not to distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2023, considering the need for capital expenditure on ongoing projects. Additionally, shareholders approved changes to the board of directors and commissioners for the period from the completion of the divestment transaction until the extraordinary general meeting in 2027. INCO set the rights issue execution price at 3,050 Indonesian rupiah per share, indicating a maximum fund raise of 1.84 trillion rupiah. The rights issue is part of fulfilling the divestment obligations of INCO shares owned by Vale Canada Limited, Sumitomo Metal Mining Co. Ltd., and Vale Japan Limited to MIND ID. The cum‑right will be traded on the regular market and in negotiations on 14 June 2024.

tickerNews.title: TPMA Announces Acquisition of 65% Stake in PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah
tickerNews.content: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) announced that the transaction value to acquire a 65% stake in PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah amounts to 32.5 million US dollars, or approximately 529.8 billion rupiah assuming an exchange rate of 16,300 rupiah per US dollar. The acquisition is part of a rights issue worth 406.5 billion rupiah scheduled for next month. The purchase will be made from PT Patin Resources, which holds a 12.05% stake in TPMA and serves as a standby buyer in the rights issue. In addition to rights‑issue proceeds, TPMA will use loans and internal cash to finance the transaction. TPMA also announced a new rights‑issue schedule, with the cum‑right to be traded on the regular market and in negotiations on 20 June 2024.

tickerNews.title: DMAS Shareholders Skip Final Dividend and Approve Board Changes
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Puradelta Lestari (DMAS) decided not to distribute a final dividend for fiscal year 2023. Previously, DMAS had paid an interim dividend of approximately 578.4 billion rupiah, or 12 rupiah per share, in December 2023. Shareholders also approved changes to the board of directors and commissioners. Hermawan Wijaya officially resigned from his position as Director and was replaced by Monik William. The shareholders also approved the appointment of Hermawan Wijaya and Masayoshi Hirose as Vice Presidents of the Board of Commissioners, replacing Teky Mailoa and Takefumi Nishikawa who resigned.

tickerNews.title: NISP Plans Merger with PT Bank Commonwealth
tickerNews.content: Bank OCBC NISP (NISP) announced a merger plan with PT Bank Commonwealth (PTBC). The merger plan follows NISP's completion of the acquisition of PTBC on 1 May 2024 and aligns with the company's strategic goal to strengthen its position in retail and SME banking. The merger will be discussed at an extraordinary general meeting on 2 August 2024 and is expected to become effective on 1 September 2024. The merger announcement was first made in November 2023 when NISP signed an acquisition agreement for PTBC valued at 2.2 trillion rupiah.
